instruction: Name one person from the Gilded Age and explain their impact on the era
output: One important figure from the Gilded Age was Cornelius Vanderbilt. He is often referred to as the "Father of Modern Capitalism" and was one of the most influential titans of industry at the time. He led the expansion of the railroad and shipping industries, thus revolutionizing transportation across the United States. He amassed a great deal of wealth and power, thus embodying the values of success and excess of the Gilded Age.
